subject: Fashion
title: Clothing as Identity Armor
description: A fast breakdown of Clothing as Identity Armor for builders.

hook.text: A teenager puts on a leather jacket and walks taller. The jacket didn't change. They did.

buildup.text: Psychologists describe clothing as 'identity armor'â€”external layers we use to protect our inner selves.

discovery.text: People facing anxiety often dress more deliberately, choosing outfits that project confidence they lack inside.

twist.text: The armor works both ways. A power suit boosts courage, but relying on it means confidence is borrowed.

climax.text: Clothes can shield us in vulnerable moments, but lasting confidence means building identity beneath them.

punchline.text: Armor protects, but real strength lives underneath.

quiz.question: What do psychologists mean by 'clothing as identity armor'?
options: Clothing physically protects the body from environmental harm
People use external clothing layers to protect and project their inner sense of self
Wearing dark colors makes a person appear more intimidating to others
